body:
### Describe the bug

Error when run with Python 3.11
````
testbld: /usr/include/python3.11/cpython/methodobject.h:59: PyCFunction_GET_FLAGS: Assertion `PyCFunction_Check(func)' failed.
Aborted (core dumped)
````



### Code to reproduce the behaviour:

testbld.py  is a trivial hello world program (just importing argparse)
````
import argparse

def main():
    parser = argparse.ArgumentParser(description="Build Test",
                                        formatter_class=argparse.ArgumentDefaultsHelpFormatter)

    parms = parser.parse_args()

if __name__ == "__main__":
    main()
````
Use Cython and cython_freeze
````
cython_freeze -o build/_start.c  testbld.py
cython -3 --no-docstrings --output-file build/testbld.c testbld.py

````

Compile into executable

````

import sys
import sysconfig
from setuptools._distutils.ccompiler import new_compiler

compiler = new_compiler()
compiler.add_include_dir(sysconfig.get_path("include"))

    if sys.platform == "linux":
        compiler.add_library(sysconfig.get_config_var("LIBRARY")[3:-2])

objects = compiler.compile(["build/_start.c", "build/testbld.c"])
compiler.link_executable(objects, "testbld", output_dir="build")
````

### Expected behaviour

This code generates a working executable with Python 3.10.6 on Linux and Windows and Python 3.11 on Windows.

NB: This is only  very simplified version of the actual problem. My actual context includes many Python files and libraries.

### Environment

Ubuntu 20.4


### Additional context

_No response_
title: [BUG]cython_freeze generatedprogram does not run with Python 3.11 on Linux
